intro: Eriogonum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and basal leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Eriogonum parviflorum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
